# Random Control Trials


[Evaluating the replicability of social science experiments in Nature and Science between 2010 and 2015](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41562-018-0399-z)

[CHANNELLING FISHER: RANDOMIZATION TESTS AND THE STATISTICAL INSIGNIFICANCE OF SEEMINGLY SIGNIFICANT EXPERIMENTAL RESULTS](https://personal.lse.ac.uk/YoungA/ChannellingFisherQJE.pdf)

**Warnings**

* Dicing RCT results up by coverates or in with a regression model instead of doing a simple T test can generate spurious results from a few high leverage outlier observations [@youngChannelingFisherRandomization2019].
